lines.text:
[Looking at a photo]
When was this last picture taken?
At Christmastime. Just before... before she left.

[Flips back to a previous page in photo album]
When was this one taken?
Several months before, around Easter in 1947. It's the best picture we've ever had of her. It's her father's favorite.
Is that why he gave it to the newspapers and the police?
Well it was an excellent likeness of her.

[Flips again to the last picture in the album]
It's not as good as this one.

[Indicating the picture taken at Easter]
This is a picture of a child, with a very pretty face, but still a child.

[flips to a later page in the photo album]
In a few months the face doesn't change much. But at the age of sixteen this is a picture of a woman in... a sweater... a very tight sweater... who was definitely not a child.
It just doesn't make sense. A missing picture, a blackmailer in California, a movie star, Doris Delaney... it can't possibly tie together.
